title: Contact preferences
description: Follow this pattern to ask users how they'd like to be contacted.

frontMatter.title: Contact preferences
frontMatter.description: Follow this pattern to ask users how they'd like to be contacted.
frontMatter.intro: Use this pattern when you want to ask a user how they'd like to be contacted, allowing them to select a preferred communication method.

when_to_use.value: **Capturing preferred contact method.** When your form requires knowing how the user prefers to be contacted.
**Form-specific requirements.** Different forms may have varying contact method options based on stakeholder needs.

design_principles.value: **Give users one choice.** Allow users to pick one method of contact using radio buttons.
**Vary options by form.** The available contact methods may differ depending on form requirements.
**Work with stakeholders.** Determine what contact information is necessary for each form.

examples.title: Method of contact
examples.description: Radio button list allowing users to select their preferred contact method.

how_to_build.intro: The contact preferences pattern uses radio buttons for single selection.

steps.value: Present contact methods as a radio button list.
Common options include: Phone, Email, Mail, or Text message.
Ensure options align with what the form/service can actually support.
Collect the corresponding contact information based on the selection.

accessibility.value: Radio buttons must be properly grouped with a fieldset and legend.
Each option must have a visible label.
Ensure keyboard navigation works correctly between options.
